Posts.Content: Nov 20, 2012 10:00PM Krissy5 wrote: Thank you all so much for all the advice!  I hadn't thought about the ongoing relationship I will establish with my doctors.  That was a good point.  I also met with my oncologist yesterday and he seems to think I will be fine working.  I just don't understand why my surgeon and him couldn't have talked for a least 5 minutes before meeting with me, so I didn't have to completely stress myself out all weekend long?!?!? He also said I won't be so sick that I'll need family to come out and stay with me during treatment.  I'm looking at doing a TCH chemo treatment cycle every 3 weeks.  Can you tell from the first infusion how your body will react to the treatment or does it get better/worse over time?  How much support have you needed?
Posts.Title: Relocation for treatment??? Krissy5 wenweb

Posts.Content: Krissy5 wrote: I was diagnosed with IDC, ER+, PR-, Grade II, HER2+ breast cancer on Tuesday.  I am a single, 30 year old second grade school teacher.  I live alone in California and most of my family is in Colorado.  I am assuming the doctors will tell me I cannot work during my 4-6 months of chemotherapy treatments and so I am considering moving.  I could move back home and live with my parents.  My newly married best friend offered to let me move in with her and her husband in DC.  I could stay in California where I have a few close friends, but I really would not want to rely on them for helping to take care of me.  I have even toyed with the idea of moving to do treatment in Hawaii and having friends and family come "vacation/visit/help" for two week stints.  Has anyone else relocated and were you happy you did?  It is hard for me to know just how much help I will be needing...
